column4: what to do if my sound suddenly stopped working after a kernel upgrade
im pretty sure i didn't touch the sound card related section from my previous config
the volume applet says that my card is not configured
I have a Conexant HD Audio device
do I need to compile some module or something?
snd-hda-intel still loaded?
please leearn to read what I wrote
uname -a
uname -a
this is no ubuntu kernel
the fact that you didn't compile sound drivers proves that you don't know at all
and you are very lucky it even booted
grep CONFIG_SND_HDA_INTEL /boot/config-2.6.23
grep CONFIG_SND_HDA_INTEL /boot/config-2.6.23*
so what does it say?
run menuconfig, enable the alsa stuff and whatever else and run make-kpkg again
imho when you want a custom kernel, make a custom one. not a copy of the distro kernel. what's the point?
run make-kpkg again. mostly only this module yes
ubuntu kernel has patches, kernel.org source doesn't, might have made a difference
anytime
